Attribute.Name: BuyerOrganizationCode
Attribute.Description:
Identifies the buying organization. Must be a valid organization defined in the system. Use the BILL_TO_ID field to bill to an address that is not set up as a valid buyer organization in the system. If not passed, and the rule in YFS_Enterprise_Doc_Type for BuyerValidation is "01" (Same as Enterprise), it is defaulted to the Enterprise of the order.
Must be a valid buyer organization defined in the system. If not valid:
It should not violate the rule set up in the YFS_Enterprise_Doc_Type table. Errors if rule is violated:

Attribute.Name: DocumentType
Attribute.Description:
Indicates the kind of order document type. For example, Sales Order document (0001), Planned Order document (0002), Return Order document (0003), and Purchase Order document (0005). This attribute determines the order's fulfillment cycle and controls the inventory and payment updates performed on the order.
Must be a valid docuent type. If not valid:

Attribute.Name: EnterpriseCode
Attribute.Description:
The Enterprise associated with the order. If not passed, it is defaulted to DEFAULT.
Must be a valid organization. If not valid:

Description.div:
Conditional. Identifies the exchange type of the order. The payment processing logic is dependent on this attribute. Valid values are: REGULAR, ADVANCED_PP, ADVANCED.
Mandatory for exchange order.
Exchange type should be defined in common code.

Attribute.Name: HasDerivedParent
Attribute.Description: A flag indicating whether the order has any derived parent. It should be passed as "Y" if the order has at least one derived orderline.

Attribute.Name: History
Attribute.Description: If History is passed with a value of "Y", the order is imported into the history tables. If this API is called with the same input XML, but first with History="N" and then with History="Y", or vice-versa, the orders are imported into both the normal tables and the history tables, respectively. The API does not check if an order being imported into the history tables already exists in the normal tables, or vice-versa. Therefore, if the same order is imported into the history tables as well as the normal tables, there will be problems with purge and restore at a later stage.

Description.div:
This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use deprecated functionality, set the rule 'Use deprecated hold Functionality'. If it is used in deprecated mode, HoldFlag will indicate if order is on hold. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has any hold. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and on order lines. In this mode based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. This flag should not be passed when rule is configured to use 7.1 functionality. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: OrderComplete
Attribute.Description: A flag indicating whether the order has reached the end of its processing life cycle. It should be passed as "Y" or "N". If not passed, it is defaulted to "Y".

Attribute.Name: OrderHeaderKey
Attribute.Description:
Primary Key for the table. This is system generated.
Must be unique. If not unique:

Description.div:
Part of the unique key for the order. The Enterprise code and order number together uniquely identify an order. Order number can be passed during order creation or generated based on a system rule setting.
Must have a non-void value. If value is void:
Value must be unique for the Enterprise. If value is not unique:

Optional. This indicates specific purpose this order is created for. For Exchange Orders, valid value is EXCHANGE. If OrderPurpose is EXCHANGE, then ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange must be specified. The system may create an order with OrderPurpose of REFUND for internal use.

This is the payment rule associated with the order. All decisions on payment handling are controlled by this rule. If not passed, it is defaulted to the default payment rule of the Seller.
Should be set up for the Seller. If not valid:

Attribute.Name: ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder
Attribute.Description: Indicates that payment methods should be copied onto the return order and that refunds should be processed there, as opposed to the original sales order. This is only valid for return orders.

Description.div:
Optional. Flag used by return orders to indicate if the return is initiated by the gift recipient.
If flag is passed 'Y' for non-return document.
All the lines of this return should be for the same ShipTo address.

Conditional. Identifies the return order header key for which this exchange order is getting created.
Mandatory for exchange order.
A return order should exist for the passed key.
No other exchange order should exist for this key.

Identifies the selling organization. Must be a valid organization defined in the system. If not passed, and the rule in YFS_Enterprise_Doc_Type for SellerValidation is "01" (Same as Enterprise), it is defaulted to the Enterprise of the order.
Must be a valid seller organization defined in the system. If not valid:
It should not violate the rule set up in the YFS_Enterprise_Doc_Type table. Errors if rule is violated:
Determines whether BOM XML specific validations should be skipped. Default: N

Attribute.Name: TotalAdjustmentAmount
Attribute.Description: The sum total of all credit and debit memos issued against this order. If TotalAdjustmentAmount is less than or greater than zero, a yfs_charge_transaction record is created with CHARGE_TYPE = ADJUSTMENTS and DEBIT_AMOUNT = TotalAdjustmentAmount.

Description.div:
Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. It overrides configuration rule for validating the item if passed non-blank. Must be set to Y to apply entitlement logic.
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if promotions and awards need to be validated and matched.
Valid Values: Y or N
Default: Y

The primary order table, containing all order documents in the system. These orders can be further classified into various types of documents. For example, ORDERS, PLANNED ORDERS, and any other types the system may provide in the future. The API creates a yfs_charge_transaction record with CHARGE_TYPE = CREATE_ORDER and BOOK_AMOUNT = TotalAmount. If InvoicedAmount > 0, a yfs_charge_transaction record is created with CHARGE_TYPE = ORDER_INVOICE, DEBIT_AMOUNT = InvoicedAmount, and BOOK_AMOUNT = - InvoicedAmount. If ReturnedAmount > 0, a yfs_charge_transaction record is created with CHARGE_TYPE = RETURN and DEBIT_AMOUNT = - ReturnedAmount.

Attribute.Name: Currency
Attribute.Description: The currency code in which the order is being processed. All price fields are assumed to be in this currency. If not passed, defaulted to EnterpriseCurrency.

Description.div:
The Enterprise's default currency code. If not passed, get the Enterprise's locale. Get the currency from the locale. The locale currency is validated for the Enterprise's ruleset (Table YFS_CURRENCY). EnterpriseCurrency is defaulted to the locale currency.
If invalid Enterprise locale:
If locale currency is not set up for the Enterprise's ruleset:

Attribute.Name: InvoicedAmount
Attribute.Description: Amount invoiced for the order

Attribute.Name: ReturnedAmount
Attribute.Description: Amount refunded due to returns against the order

Description.div:
This element is mandatory. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
This element is mandatory. If element is absent in the input XML:
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. In addition, for Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, this element must be present in both the order header and order line.
If all attributes in element have a void value:
For Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, if element absent in order header and order line:

This element is optional. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

This element is optional. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

Detailed notes.
Must be non-void. If void:

Free-form text indicating any additional information related to the instruction type or otherwise.
Must be non-void. If void:

Identifies the type of address. Part of unique key.
Must be non-void. If void:

This element is mandatory. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
This element is mandatory. If element is absent in the input XML:
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

The tax name.
Must be non-void. If void:

PaymentMethod can be added, modified or removed .
If payment processing is not required for the order, any payment method passed in the input xml is still subject to validations.
Only the PaymentMethod attributes specified in the input xml can be changed. Attempting to change other attributes on PaymentMethod , such as TotalAuthorized or TotalCharged results in an error.
Pass changed value for attributes not specfied in input xml.

Used to identify the order to which charges are applied.
The Seller Organization can configure the payment types so that they are charged and refunded in a particular sequence. The charge sequence and refund sequence are independent of each other. A PaymentType with a ChargeSequence set to
0
is charged before another PaymentType with ChargeSequence set to
1
.
The Buyer can also specify the ChargeSequence of the PaymentMethod in the createOrder input xml. If a charge sequence is not specified by the Buyer, the Seller's ChargeSequence is followed.
If both the Buyer and the Seller supply ChargeSequence , charges are made in the order that the Seller specifies, but within a particular charge type, such as CreditCard, the Buyer's sequence is honored.
For example:
A seller specifies the ChargeSequence as 0 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, 1 for CREDIT_CARD, 2 for OTHER.
A buyer specifies the ChargeSequence as 1 for MyBank-CreditCard, 2 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, and 3 for MyOther-CreditCard.
The payment methods are charged in the following sequence:
CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, MyBank-CreditCard, MyOther-CreditCard.
The Customer account is charged because that is the seller's preferred method, and the two credit cards are charged based on the order that the buyer specified.
The Entry Type used to enter payment information into the system.

Type of payment.
The PaymentType must be a value that is already configured for the Seller Organization.
If a PaymentMethod element is passed, the PaymentType is validated, even if payment processing is not required for the order.
Must be a value defined for the Seller Organization.
PaymentType must be passed.

Description.p: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Description.div: This field is used as an Identifier for recording a response for transaction closed as asynchronous. Pass AsyncRequestIdentifier only when ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is set to "Y". AsyncRequestIdentifier will be ignored if ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is passed as "N". Use AsyncRequestIdentifier as an identifier to record the response of a asynchronous transaction only once. AsyncRequestIdentifier can be associated to a asynchronously closed transaction in the user exit.

Description.p: AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. This data will be stored on YFS_ORDER_AUDIT table. Also in case of APIs that cause the creation of a CHARGE_REQUEST, the same field will be stored on YFS_CHARGE_TRANSACTION table.

The type of charge that is being applied to the order.
Valid Values: AUTHORIZATION or CHARGE . Invalid value is passed.
The date and time when the charge is realized.It can be future date.When this date is passed in input xml, Is_Collection_Date_Firm flag is set to Y.

This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

This flag indicates that the transaction represents an in person, or card in hand, transaction. A transaction that is in person will distribute against in person order totals and invoices, and vice versa.

This flag indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway but was unable to contact it. This should only be passed for unprocessed records, as this may be updated to N by the user exit, and will be reset to null when the record moves to CLOSED status.

The EntryType used to enter payment information into the system, such as by a magnetic card reader. If passed, this attribute will take precedence over other attributes for the entry type of the transaction.

If ProcessedAmount is passed as a value greater than zero, the STATUS in the CHARGE_TRANSACTION table is set to CLOSED .
If ProcessedAmount is passed as zero or not passed, the STATUS will be set to OPEN, unless RequestProcessed is passed as Y. The ProcessedAmount is used to update CHARGE_TRANSACTION table, depending on the charge type. If the ChargeType value is :
AUTHORIZATION - the OpenAuthorizedAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
CHARGE - the CreditAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
This field can be used to store reason code for transaction update.

For ChargeTypes CHARGE and AUTHORIZATION, this field holds the amount that is requested for charging/authorization. If RequestAmount is passed, it is set as the RequestAmount of the chargetransaction record and the TranAmount of the creditcardtransaction record.

If the value of this is Y , the payment details record will be treated as already processed. This flag is considered only when ProcessedAmount is 0 . Request with ProcessedAmount greater than or less than 0 is always considered as processed.

Description.div: Stores releases made against an order.

The release number. Generated as a one up number against that release.
Must be an integer >=1 and unique for the order. If invalid:

Attribute.Name: ReqCancelDate
Attribute.Description: The requested cancel date. This is defaulted from Order if it is not provided in the input XML.

Description.div:
A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. In addition, for Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, this element must be present in both the order header and order line.
If all attributes in element have a void value:
For Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, if element absent in order header and order line:

This element is optional. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

Detailed notes.
Must be non-void. If void:

OrderLineRelationship contains the ParentLine and ChildLine elements which identify the Parent and Child line. Both ParentLine and ChildLine elements must be passed to uniquely identify the lines. If multiple OrderLineRelationships need to be made, multiple OrderLineRelationship nodes should be passed. Refer to ParentLine and ChildLine elements for further details.
The type of relationship between the parent and the child line.

Specifies the parent and the child line being related. When a new relationship is created by passing the OrderLineRelationship the following validation is performed.
If either the parent line or the child line is not passed with the appropriate line identifiers the following error is displayed.

Primary key generated by the system. May be passed to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo can be passed.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element and in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Primary key generated by the system.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Part of an order line's unique key.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

Part of unique key of line.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element as well in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

Stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple lines can be created for a single order (YFS_ORDER_HEADER). Either PipelineKey or both PipelineId and PipelineOwnerKey must be provided.
If either PipelineKey or both PipelineId and PipelineOwnerKey are missing from the input or have a void value:
If PipelineKey is passed in the input, it is used as passed, without validating if the pipeline actually exists in the system. If PipelineKey is erroneous, there can be problems in further processing. However, this API will not perform any validations. PipelineKey is also stored in the ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS records of the line.
If both PipelineId and PipelineOwnerKey are passed in the input, instead of PipelineKey, the API fetches the corresponding Pipeline object and obtains the PipelineKey. If the API does not find the pipeline:

Indicates if any order lines are dependant on the parent order line. This field can only be specified for the parent line. If this field is specified, it is defaulted on all of the dependant lines. This field is ignored if it is specified on a dependant line. Valid values: Null, "01", or "02".
If void:

The minimum order line quantity that must be fulfilled in an order release before it is shipped.
FillQuantity must be >0 and less than or equal to OrderedQty. If void:

Specifies a collection of items that form a unit. For example, a home theatre system is a unit consisting of kit components, such as a DVD player, TV, CD player, etc. Valid values = Null, "LK", or "PK". If KitCode = LK or PK, this API will not validate if KitLines have been passed in the input XML. This API will also not pull Kit component information from the catalogue if KitLines are not present in the input XML. It will not throw an error if KitLines exist but KitCode is void in the input XML.
If void:

Primary key generated by the system.
Should be unique. If not unique:

The quantity of the line item that has been ordered. If part of the line is cancelled, this number is reduced appropriately. If an order line is returned, this number is not reduced.
Must be >=0. If invalid:

A flag indicating if this line is parent of a dependent group. If the line is parent of a dependent group, pass ParentOfDependentGroup="Y" in the input XML. However, the API will not do any validation.

The order line number. Part of an order line's unique key.
Must be >=0. If invalid:
Part of unique key of line. If SubLineNo is less than or equal to 0, then it is set to 1 by this API.

The identifier for the Item. The ItemID, UnitOfMeasure, and ProductClass form the unique inventory identifier for an order line. The ItemID, UnitOfMeasure, and OrganizationCode form the unique item identifier for Product Management. This API will not obtain other Item information (such as ItemDesc) from the catalogue, based on ItemID, UnitOfMeasure, ProductClass, and Enterprise. If the ItemID is not passed, the catalog will be searched for an item with the same alias as the AlternateItemID, and the ItemID will be populated from the resulting item. If an item is not found in catalog, the AlternateItemID is used as the ItemID.
Must be non-void. If void:

The component item ID. This API will not obtain other Item information (such as ItemDesc) from the catalogue, based on ItemID, UnitOfMeasure, ProductClass, and Enterprise.
Must be non-void. If void:

The number of components required for one kit.
Must be >0. If not >0:

A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. In addition, for Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, this element must be present in both the order header and order line.
If all attributes in element have a void value:
For Order/OrderLines/OrderLine/PersonInfoShipTo, if element absent in order header and order line:

People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

Detailed notes.
Must be non-void. If void:

Free-form text indicating any additional information related to the instruction type or otherwise.
Must be non-void. If void:

Identifies the type of address. Part of unique key.
Must be non-void. If void:

This element is mandatory. A generic table used to store relevant person infomation and addresses. Addresses are typically an organization address, ship node address, customer address, and so forth. People information is required in cases where person to person contact needs to be established (for example, taking appointments, or speaking during negotiations). The key of this table is posted in various tables to allow access to person and address information.
This element is mandatory. If element is absent in the input XML:
At least one attribute in this element must have a non-void value. If all attributes in the element have a void value:

Stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple lines can be created for a single order (YFS_ORDER_HEADER).
DEPENDENT_ON_LINE_KEY of the order line is populated based on (DependentOnPrimeLineNo, DependentOnSubLineNo). The (DependentOnPrimeLineNo, DependentOnSubLineNo) must map to a (PrimeLineNo, SubLineNo) of this order. Otherwise an error is thrown. However, this API does not check for self-dependency or circular-dependency. A dependent line should have the same values as the parent line for the following attributes: DependencyShippingRule, ReqDeliveryDate, ReqShipDate, ReceivingNode, MergeNode, ShipToKey, ShipNode. However, this API does not do any validation in this regard.

The DerivedFrom element is required if the orderline is derived from an orderline of an existing order (referred to as the parentline hereafter ). {OrderLineKey} or {OrderHeaderKey, PrimeLineNo, SubLineNo} or {OrderNo, DocumentType , EnterpriseCode, PrimeLineNo, SubLineNo} are required to identify the parent orderline. The {OrderReleaseKey} or {OrderHeaderKey, ReleaseNo} or {OrderNo, EnterpriseCode, ReleaseNo} are required to identify the parent order release.
If OrderHeaderKey, OrderLineKey, and OrderReleaseKey (where applicable) are passed in the input, the API does not do any validation and stores the input values in the columns DERIVED_FROM_ORDER_HEADER_KEY, DERIVED_FROM_ORDER_LINE_KEY and DERIVED_FROM_ORDER_RELEASE_KEY of the order line table. Otherwise, the API searches for the parent order and/or parent release in the system and throws an error if the parent cannot be found. Therefore, the sequencing of imported orders is important in this case. The parent order must be imported first and then the derived order(s).
If not imported in correct order:

Attribute.Name: EnterpriseCode
Attribute.Description: EnterpriseCode of parent Order.

Attribute.Name: OrderHeaderKey
Attribute.Description: OrderHeaderKey of parent Order.

Attribute.Name: OrderLineKey
Attribute.Description: OrderLineKey of parent OrderLine.

Attribute.Name: OrderNo
Attribute.Description: OrderNo of parent Order.

Attribute.Name: OrderReleaseKey
Attribute.Description: OrderReleaseKey of parent OrderRelease.

Attribute.Name: PrimeLineNo
Attribute.Description: PrimeLineNo of parent OrderLine.

Attribute.Name: ReleaseNo
Attribute.Description: ReleaseNo of parent OrderRelease.

Attribute.Name: SubLineNo
Attribute.Description: SubLineNo of parent OrderLine.

Description.div:
The tax name.
Must be non-void. If void:

The EXPECTED_SHIPMENT_DATE of the yfs_order_release_status record is populated from the ExpectedShipmentDate of the OrderStatus/Schedule element.
This API validates that for each order line, the sum of StatusQty is equal to the OrderedQty of the line. The StatusQty of cancelled statuses are ignored while validating against line quantity.
If StatusQty is not equal to OrderedQty:

Link to YFS_ORDER_RELEASE or YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_H table.
ReleaseNo, if passed, must be among the ReleaseNos of the OrderRelease elements of this order. If invalid:

If the Status is not defined for the relevant process type, the Status record is not used for further processing. However, the API does not do any validation.
Must be non-void. If void:

Contains order line schedule information for Order Lines. An order line can be broken up into multiple schedules. Each schedule contains information about ShipNode, ReceivingNode, ExpectedShipmentDate, ExpectedDeliveryDate, and info about any tags associated with the order line.
ExpectedDeliveryDate, if not passed in the input, is defaulted from the ReqDeliveryDate of OrderLine. ExpectedShipmentDate, if not passed in the input, is defaulted from the ReqShipDate of OrderLine.

Element.Description:
Identifies the bundle parent order line for this line.
OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo or TransactionalLineId must be passed, and must identify a valid order line.

Description.div: The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element and in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be passed for a single order. These hold types will be applied during import order.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied on Order.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Promotion references associated to the promotion. In case of internal promotions, the promotion references will be automatically associated to the generated awards proportional to the awarded quantity.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Delete - Removes the PromotionReference. If Operation is not passed the PromotionReference will be created if it does not exist already.

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award
Manual Line Charge generated by this Award must not conflict with non-manual Line Charge already on OrderLine

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

Attribute.Name: PersonInfoKey
Attribute.Description: The person info record to store this answer set for.

Description.div:
The question type associated to the defined answer set.
QuestionType not passed.
Invalid QuestionType.

The answer for the question.
AnswerValue passed should be a valid answer for the question it belongs to.

Identifier for the question that this answer is for.
QuestionID should be valid.
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be passed for a single order. These hold types will be applied during import order.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied on Order.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Promotion references associated to the promotion. In case of internal promotions, the promotion references will be automatically associated to the generated awards proportional to the awarded quantity.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Delete - Removes the PromotionReference. If Operation is not passed the PromotionReference will be created if it does not exist already.

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

Attribute.Name: TotalNumberOfRecords
Attribute.Description: Number of Attachments in the Order.

Attribute.Name: FileAttachmentKey
Attribute.Description: The key of the attached file

Attribute.Name: FileContentType
Attribute.Description: Type of the file content as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileDescription
Attribute.Description: Description of the file content as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileLocation
Attribute.Description: The location of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileName
Attribute.Description: Complete name of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileSize
Attribute.Description: Size of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Description.div:
Action to take
Valid Value:
Delete - Deletes the file attachment.

Attribute.Name: ModificationLevel
Attribute.Description: Level at which modification is done. Order, Order_Line, Order_Release or Order_Release_Line.

Description.div: A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not accepted in input. This TransactionalLineId is not stored in the database and cannot be used after an order has been created.

Attribute.Name: Action
Attribute.Description: Action

Attribute.Name: AuditType
Attribute.Description: Audit Type

Attribute.Name: Name
Attribute.Description: Name of the ID

Attribute.Name: Value
Attribute.Description: Value of the ID

Attribute.Name: Extended
Attribute.Description: Determines whether the attribute is an extended field. If this attribute is not available, then it means the attribute is not extended.

Attribute.Name: ModificationType
Attribute.Description: Modification Type used for changing the attribute

Attribute.Name: Name
Attribute.Description: Name of the Attribute Changed

Attribute.Name: NewValue
Attribute.Description: New Value of the attribute modified

Attribute.Name: OldValue
Attribute.Description: Old Value of the attribute modified
